author: @WSMV
title: Rainbow arches over Tennessee home struck by lightning during Friday’s storms
text: Rainbow arches over Tennessee home struck by lightning during Friday’s storms “Thankfully we are all ok and it’s just by the hand of God that we weren’t hurt.” NASHVILLE, Tenn. (WSMV) - A Gallatin couple said they were home Friday morning when their house was struck by lightning. When the fire department responded, Curtis Knowles, the homeowner, said it was the largest strike they had ever seen. That lightning strike ripped the siding on the frame of the roof off. But it’s the damage on the inside that’s going to have long-lasting effects. While pieces of siding hang by a thread, Knowles and his wife are still holding on after lightning struck their house Friday morning. “The fireman showed us where it came in the house was about one foot behind where she was sitting having a Zoom meeting,” he said. Inside, the drywall was taken out, exposing insulation. The entire home electrical system was fried and must be replaced. Knowles said once the lightning struck, it exited through the gutter on the side. “Miraculously she wasn’t hurt,” he said. “Neither of us were hurt.” Knowles said their insurance will put them in a hotel for now. But they will need to be put in a temporary long-term home at some point because rewiring an entire home is no easy feat. “Thankfully we are all ok and it’s just by the hand of God that we weren’t hurt,” he said. “And that’s what we are really thankful for, extremely blessed.” Knowles said neighbors also saw some damage. Later in the day, a rainbow arched over the home. Copyright 2024 WSMV. All rights reserved.

title: 中证2000ETF易方达（159532）跌1.00%，半日成交额260.64万元|易方达_新浪财经_新浪网
text:

author: Austin Corona, Aspen Daily News Staff Writer
title: Relief on its way for dry spell | News | aspendailynews.com
text: Meteorologists expect that Aspen will receive much-needed snow in January after two months of relatively dry conditions mixed with some precipitation. Megan Sanders, a meteorologist at the National Weather Service office in Grand Junction, said an “unsettled pattern” is due to develop in the western United States this week, which will place Aspen in the most likely path for storms. Sanders said Aspen could get around 1 to 3 inches of snow on Thursday and potentially more than that on Saturday, with the possibility for yet another storm on Sunday or Monday. Though Aspen will see precipitation, she said the storms will likely be more favorable for areas south of the Roaring Fork Valley. She said the NWS predicts that the system will continue to bring precipitation to western Colorado for the following week as well. Cory Gates, meteorologist for local weather service [aspenweather.net](http://aspenweather.net), said he is generally looking forward to an uptick in snowfall this month. Gates said the highest likelihood for solid snowfall will come after Jan. 12, when low-pressure systems are expected to arrive as U-shaped troughs conducive to broad regional snowfall. January snowfall could cap off a two-month slow spell for Aspen ski areas. Gates, who calculates historical snowfall averages for each month at three Aspen ski mountains (all but Buttermilk), said the mountains saw roughly 70% of their combined average snowfall last December and November. Typically, the mountains each receive around 50 inches of snow in December, which dipped to around 37 inches last month. Sanders called the last two months “slow” in terms of precipitation. For Gates, the biggest factor behind the dry period is “closed lows” — low-pressure systems with abnormal circular shapes that have often missed the Roaring Fork Valley in recent months. Gates said most low-pressure systems have U-shaped troughs and extend across the intermountain west, distributing snowstorms over large areas. Closed lows, on the other hand, cover a much smaller geographic area and often track to the west and south of Aspen. Gates said he is confident about the days following Jan. 12 because that is when some low-pressure systems traveling through Aspen will arrive in their typical U-shaped figure. “When we get toward the 12th and onward, we have a few normal-looking troughs, which is a good sign,“ Gates said. Gates said he’s hoping for 2 feet at the three ski areas from Jan. 6-20, adding that he realistically hopes for 60 inches through the whole month. If Aspen ski areas get around 80 inches in January, it would return the whole November-through-January period to its historical average for snowfall. Gates said an 80-inch January may be a tall order, but it’s possible. In general, he said the three Aspen ski areas have seen average snowfall this winter, although that average was boosted by a huge storm in October before the mountains were open. Without October, he said it will take a 60-inch January and average monthly snowfall for the rest of the season to deliver an average snow year at Aspen ski areas. Across the Western Slope, Sanders said this winter started dry, with this year’s snowpack failing to keep up with last year’s numbers. Data included in a Dec. 28 snowpack report from Basalt-based nonprofit the Roaring Fork Conservancy showed snowpack at 88% of normal throughout the Roaring Fork River basin and 69% of normal for the Colorado River basin above Lake Powell. Gates said it’s far too early to tell how the whole winter will shake out. He noted that huge, season-defining storms often roll in as late as March and April. “It's a long winter here. Just remember that,” he said.

author: @zupyak.com
title: Solar Power Florida: A Wise Investment For Future Generations
text:
Are you looking for a sustainable energy solution for your home or business? Look no further than
Solar Power Florida. With concerns about climate change and rising energy costs, investing in solar power offers both environmental and financial benefits for future generations. Read on to learn how this renewable energy source can benefit you.
What Is Solar Power?
Solar power Florida is a form of renewable energy that transforms sunlight into electricity. This is achieved through the use of solar panels, which contain photovoltaic cells that capture and convert sunlight into usable energy.
The use of solar power brings about many advantages, such as:
- decreased greenhouse gas emissions
- reduced electricity costs
- the ability to achieve energy independence
It is a sustainable and eco-friendly alternative to traditional energy sources that rely on fossil fuels. By utilizing the energy of the sun, solar power offers a clean and efficient solution for meeting our energy demands.
How Does Solar Power Work?
Solar power is a renewable energy source that harnesses sunlight to produce electricity. Knowing the process is crucial in understanding its advantages. Here are the steps involved in this process:
- Photovoltaic (PV) panels absorb sunlight.
- Solar cells within the panels convert sunlight into direct current (DC) electricity.
- An inverter transforms DC electricity into alternating current (AC) electricity.
- The AC electricity then flows into the electrical panel, providing power to the building.
- Excess electricity can be stored in batteries or fed back into the grid.
What Are the Benefits of Solar Power?
Solar power is a rapidly growing industry in Florida, and for good reason. As we look towards the future, it is crucial that we invest in sustainable and renewable energy sources. In this section, we will explore the numerous benefits of solar power florida and why it is a wise investment for future generations. From being a cost-effective option to reducing our carbon footprint, solar power offers a multitude of advantages. Let's dive into each of these benefits in more detail to understand the value of this energy source.
1. Renewable and Sustainable Energy Source
Renewable and sustainable energy sources, such as solar power Florida, offer numerous benefits for both the environment and consumers. To adopt this eco-friendly option, consider the following steps:
- Assess your energy needs: Determine your electricity usage and evaluate whether solar power can meet your requirements.
- Research
solar paneloptions: Explore different types of solar panels, their efficiency, and compatibility with your location.
- Find a reputable solar installer: Seek out experienced professionals who can efficiently handle the installation process and ensure optimal performance.
- Consider financing options: Explore financing options such as purchasing the system outright, leasing, or taking advantage of government incentives and tax credits.
- Monitor and maintain your system: Regularly monitor the performance of your solar panels and schedule maintenance to ensure they continue operating effectively.
By following these steps, you can embrace solar power as a renewable and sustainable energy source for your home or business.
2. Cost-Effective and Money-Saving
Investing in solar power in Florida is not only a cost-effective and money-saving decision but also an environmentally friendly one. To ensure a cost-effective solar power investment, follow these steps:
- Research and compare different solar panel system options, taking into account their upfront costs, energy production capabilities, and warranties.
- Consult with solar energy providers to determine the financial incentives, tax credits, and rebates available to offset the initial investment.
- Calculate the estimated savings on electricity bills over the lifespan of the system, considering potential increases in electricity rates over time.
- Explore financing options such as solar loans or leasing programs that offer low or no upfront costs and allow for gradual payment of the system.
- If owning a solar panel system is not feasible, consider joining a community solar project to still benefit from solar power without individual installation.
- Regularly monitor and maintain the solar panel system to ensure optimal performance and energy production.
With the abundant sunshine in Florida and the available government incentives, investing in solar power can lead to significant cost savings and long-term financial benefits.
3. Reduces Carbon Footprint and Helps Fight Climate Change
Switching to solar power can significantly reduce carbon emissions and contribute to the ongoing fight against climate change. Here are some steps to consider for reducing your carbon footprint through solar power:
- Assess your energy needs: Determine your current electricity consumption and identify areas where you can decrease energy usage.
- Choose a solar system: Select a solar panel system that fits your energy needs and budget.
- Install solar panels: Hire a professional to install the solar panels on your property.
- Connect to the grid: Contact your utility company to connect your solar system to the grid, allowing you to export excess energy and earn credits.
- Monitor and maintain: Regularly monitor your solar system's performance and conduct maintenance to ensure optimal efficiency.
4. Increases Property Value
Installing solar power systems can greatly enhance the value of your property. Here are some steps to consider:
- Research solar companies in your area with a proven track record of increasing property value.
- Consult with a professional to assess your property's solar potential and determine the optimal system size.
- Obtain multiple quotes for solar installation, comparing costs, warranties, and system performance.
- Consider financing options, such as loans or leasing, to make the investment more affordable.
- Install the solar power system and ensure it is properly connected and functioning.
- Keep documentation of the solar installation, including warranties and permits, for future reference.
- Market your property as having solar power, highlighting the financial and environmental benefits to potential buyers.
Why Is Solar Power Florida a Wise Investment for Future Generations?
As the world continues to shift towards renewable energy sources, solar power florida is emerging as a wise investment for future generations. In this section, we will discuss the various reasons why this is the case. First, we will explore the abundance of sunshine in the Sunshine State and how it makes solar power an ideal renewable energy option. Then, we will delve into the government incentives and tax credits available for solar power Florida. Lastly, we will discuss how investing in solar power can protect against rising energy costs, providing long-term financial and environmental benefits.
1. Abundance of Sunshine
Florida is renowned for its abundance of sunshine, making it an ideal location for harnessing solar power. If you're interested in investing in solar power Florida, here are a few steps to get started:
- Evaluate your energy needs and determine how much solar power you require.
- Research reputable solar companies in Florida and request quotes for solar panel installations.
- Consider financing options such as purchasing a solar panel system outright, leasing a system, or participating in a community solar project.
- Review government incentives and tax credits available for solar installations in Florida.
- Choose an experienced installer who can handle the design, permitting, and installation process.
- Maintain your solar panels by cleaning them regularly and scheduling professional inspections.
In recent years, Florida has experienced a significant increase in solar power installations thanks to its favorable climate conditions. The state has taken measures to promote
solar energy through legislation and incentives, making it an attractive option for residents and businesses looking to reduce their carbon footprint and save on energy costs. As solar technology continues to advance, Florida's abundance of sunshine will undoubtedly play a crucial role in its transition to a greener and more sustainable future.
2. Government Incentives and Tax Credits
Government incentives and tax credits play a crucial role in promoting the adoption of solar power. These incentives can significantly offset the cost of installing solar panels in Florida. The federal Investment Tax Credit (ITC) allows homeowners to deduct a percentage of their solar system's cost from their federal taxes. Additionally, the state of Florida offers property tax exemptions for residential solar energy systems, providing substantial savings over time. These incentives make solar power more accessible and affordable, encouraging individuals to invest in renewable energy and contribute to a sustainable future. In fact, the federal ITC currently offers a 26% tax credit for residential
solar installation in 2021.
3. Protection Against Rising Energy Costs
Investing in solar power in Florida can provide protection against the unpredictability of rising energy costs. Here are steps to consider:
- Evaluate your energy needs and potential savings.
- Research available solar panel systems and installation companies.
- Calculate the initial investment cost and determine the payback period.
- Explore government incentives and tax credits that can reduce the upfront cost.
- Consider financing options like solar loans or leasing agreements.
- Choose a reputable solar installer and schedule the installation.
- Monitor your energy production and savings after the installation.
- Plan for ongoing maintenance and upkeep costs to ensure optimal system performance.
By investing in solar power, you can protect yourself from the unpredictability of rising energy costs and enjoy long-term savings.
Conclusion
Embracing solar power in Florida is not just a smart move for the present, but a crucial investment for the well-being of future generations. With its abundant sunshine, cost-effectiveness, and a range of government incentives, solar power stands as a beacon of sustainability and financial prudence. By reducing carbon footprints, increasing property values, and providing a shield against escalating energy costs, solar power in Florida emerges as a wise choice that benefits both individuals and the environment. As we navigate the path towards a greener and more sustainable future, solar power proves to be a beacon of hope, promising a cleaner, more resilient, and economically viable energy landscape for generations to come.
